DyPy documentation¶

DyPy is a generic Python backward dynamic programming solver focused on ease and flexibility. It tries to provide simple, and easy to use defaults that can be overridden to build larger and more complex dynamic programs.

DyPy is still very new and caution should be exercised in using it. The code base is still seeing large changes which may or may not break existing functionality. It currently is tested against a few small problems, but those tests may or may not work on a given day. Get in touch if you have questions or want to contribute. If you just need a working dynamic programming library now, check out ProDyn
